intro: Terminalia seyrigii, commonly known as the African snowball tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its white, fluffy inflorescences that resemble snowballs, hence its common name. The plant produces small, oval-shaped fruits that contain a single seed. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Terminalia seyrigii is valued for its ornamental beauty and has traditional uses in local medicine.
